elements.description:
Events based access to projects datastore.

Note: **All events must be cancelable.** When the event is cancelled by an
instance of the element it won't be handled again by other instance that
possibly exists in the DOM.

Cancellable event is a request to models for change. Non-cancellable event
is a notification for views to update their values.
For example `project-object-changed` event notifies model to update object in
the datastore if the event is cancelable and to update views if it's not
cancellable.

Each handled event contains the `result` property on the `detail` object. It
contains a `Promise` object with a result of the operation. Also, for update
/ delete events the same non-cancelable event is fired.

Events handled by this element are cancelled and propagation of the event is
stopped.

See model description here:
https://github.com/advanced-rest-client/api-components-api/blob/master/docs/
arc-models.md#arcproject

Supported operations:

-   Read project object (`project-read`)
-   Update name only (`project-name-changed`)
-   Update project object (`project-object-changed`)
-   Delete object (`project-object-deleted`)
-   Query for projects (`project-model-query`)

### Events description

#### `project-read` event

Reads a project object from the datastore.

##### Properties
-   `id` (String, required) ID of the datastore entry
-   `rev` (String, optional) Specific revision to retrieve from the datastore.
Latest by default.

##### Example

```javascript
var event = new CustomEvent('project-read', {
   detail: { id: 'some-id' },
   bubbles: true,
   composed: true,
   cancelable: true
});
document.body.dispatchEvent(event);
if (event.defaultPrevented) {
   event.detail.result.then(project => console.log(project));
}
```

#### `project-object-changed` event

Updates / saves new object in the datastore.

##### Properties

-   `project` (Object, required) An object to store

##### Example

```javascript
var event = new CustomEvent('project-object-changed', {
   detail: { project: {...} },
   bubbles: true,
   composed: true,
   cancelable: true
});
document.body.dispatchEvent(event);
if (event.defaultPrevented) {
   event.detail.result.then(project => console.log(project));
}
```

#### `project-object-deleted` event

Deletes the object from the datastore. This operation fires
`project-object-deleted` custom event. Promise returns object's
new `_rev` value.

##### Properties
-   `id` (String, required) ID of the datastore entry
-   `rev` (String, optional) The `_rev` property of the PouchDB datastore
object. If not set it will use latest revision.

##### Example

```javascript
var event = new CustomEvent('project-object-deleted', {
   detail: { id: 'some-id' },
   bubbles: true,
   composed: true,
   cancelable: true
});
document.body.dispatchEvent(event);
if (event.defaultPrevented) {
   event.detail.result.then(newRev => console.log(newRev));
}
```

#### `project-model-query` event

Reads the list of all projects. Promise resolves to the list of projects.
This event doesn't requeire any properties but **the `details` object must be set**.

##### Example

```javascript
var event = new CustomEvent('project-model-query', {
   detail: {}, // THIS MUST BE SET
   bubbles: true,
   composed: true,
   cancelable: true
});
document.body.dispatchEvent(event);
if (event.defaultPrevented) {
   event.detail.result.then(list => console.log(list));
}
```

elements.name: LogicElements.ProjectModel

events.name: project-object-changed
events.description: Fired when the project entity has been saved / updated in the datastore.

elements.description:
Event based access to saved and history request datastore.

This model creates and updates updates request objects and updates
URL index associated with the request.
It also supports querying for request data, deleting request data and
undeleting it.

## Events API

All events must be marked as cancelable or will be ignore by the model.
In ARC ecosystem models dispatch the same event after the object is updated
(deleted, created, updated) but the event is not cancelable.
Components should only react on non cancelable model events as it means
that the change has been commited to the datastore.

Each handled event is canceled so it's safe to put more than one model in
the DOM. Event's detail object will get `result` property with the promise
resolved when operation commits.

**save-request**
This event should be used when dealing with unprocessed request data.
Request object may contain Blob or FormData as a payload which would be lost
if trying to store it in the data store. This flow handles payload
transformation.

Detail's parameteres:
- request - Required, ArcRequest object
- projects - Optional, Array of strings, List of project names to create
with this request and associate with the request object.
- options - Optional, map of additional options. Currently only `isDrive` is
supported. When set `export-google-drive` is dispatched. If the event is not
handled by the application the save flow fails.

```javascript
const e = new CustomEvent('save-request', {
 bubbles: true,
 composed: true,
 cancelable: true,
 detail: {
   request: {...}
   projects: ['Test project'],
   options: {
     isDrive: true
   }
 }
};
this.dispatchEvent(e);
```

**request-object-read**

Reads the request from the data store.

Detail's parameteres:

- `id` - Required, String. Request ID
- `type` - Required, String. Either `history` or `saved`
- `rev` - Optional, String. Specific revision to read

**request-object-changed**

Should be only used if the payload is not `Blob` or `FormData` and
all request properties are set. By default `save-request` event should be
used.

Detail's parameteres: ArcRequest object.
https://github.com/advanced-rest-client/api-components-api/blob/master/docs/
arc-models.md#arcrequest

**request-object-deleted**

Deletes the object from the data store.

Detail's parameteres:

- `id` - Required, String. Request ID
- `type` - Required, String. Either `history` or `saved`

**request-objects-deleted**

Deletes number of requests in bulk.

Detail's parameteres:

- `type` - Required, String. Either `history` or `saved`
- `items` - Required, Array<String>. List of request IDs to delete.

**request-objects-undeleted**

Used to restore deleted request data.

Detail's parameteres:

- `type` - Required, String. Either `history` or `saved`
- `items` - Required, Array<Object>. List of requests to restore.
Each object must contain `_rev` and `_id`.

The `result` property contains result of calling `revertRemove()` function.

**request-query**

Queries for request data. This flow searches for URL data in a separate index
and then performs full text search on the request data store.

Detail's parameteres:

- `q` - Required, String. User query.
- `type` - Optional, String. Either `history` or `saved`. By default it
searches in both data stores.
- `detailed` - Optional, Boolean. If set it uses slower algorithm but performs full
search on the index. When false it only uses filer like query + '*'.

properties.name: eventsTarget
properties.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on
`window` object. If set, all events listeners will be attached to this
object instead of `window`.

properties.name: _oldEventsTarget
properties.description: An event target used to attach listeners.

properties.name: historyIndexes
properties.description: List of fields to index in the history store.

properties.name: savedIndexes
properties.description: List of fields to index in the saved store.

properties.name: noIndexing
properties.description: When set it skips request indexing.

methods.name: _eventsTargetChanged
methods.description:
Removes old handlers (if any) and attaches listeners on new event
event target.

params.name: eventsTarget
params.description:
Event target to set handlers on. If not set it
will set handlers on the `window` object.

methods.name: _attachListeners
methods.description: Adds event listeners.

methods.name: _detachListeners
methods.description: Removes event listeners.

methods.name: read
methods.description: Reads an entry from the datastore.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the datastore entry.

params.name: rev
params.description:
Specific revision to read. Defaults to
latest revision.

return.desc: Promise resolved to a project object.

methods.name: _computeMidnight
methods.description: Computes past mindnight for given timestamp.

return.desc: Time reduced to midnight.

methods.name: _fireUpdated
methods.description: Dispatches non-cancelable change event.

return.desc: Created and dispatched event.

methods.name: _handleException
methods.description: Handles any exception in the model in a unified way.

params.name: noThrow
params.description:
If set the function will not throw error.
This allow to do the logic without stopping program.

methods.name: getDatabase
methods.description: Returns a reference to a PouchDB database instance for given type.

return.desc: PouchDB instance for the datastore.

methods.name: updateProject
methods.description:
Updates / saves a project object in the datastore.
This function fires `project-object-changed` event.

return.desc: Resolved promise to project object with updated `_rev`

methods.name: removeProject
methods.description:
Removed an object from the datastore.
This function fires `project-object-deleted` event.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the datastore entry.

params.name: rev
params.description: Specific revision to read. Defaults to latest revision.

return.desc: Promise resolved to a new `_rev` property of deleted object.

methods.name: _saveRequestHandler
methods.description:
A handler for `save-request-data` custom event. It's special event to
save / update request data dispatched by the request editor.

methods.name: _createProjects
methods.description:
Create projects from project names.
It is used when creating a request with a new project.

params.name: requestId
params.description: Request ID to add to the projects.

return.desc: Promise resolved to list of project IDs

methods.name: saveRequest
methods.description:
Saves a request into a data store.
It handles payload to string conversion, handles types, and syncs request
with projects. Use `update()` method only if you are storing already
prepared request object to the store.

params.name: opts
params.description:
Save request object. Currently only `isDrive`
is supported

return.desc: A promise resilved to updated request object.

methods.name: _syncProjects
methods.description:
Sunchronizes project requests to ensure each project contains this
`requestId` on their list of requests.

methods.name: update
methods.description:
Updates / saves the request object in the datastore.
This function fires `request-object-changed` event.

If any of `name`, `method`, `url` or `legacyProject` properties change
then the old object is deleted and new is created with new ID.

return.desc: Resolved promise to request object with updated `_rev`

methods.name: updateBulk
methods.description: Updates more than one request in a bulk.

return.desc: List of PouchDB responses to each insert

methods.name: remove
methods.description:
Removed an object from the datastore.
This function fires `request-object-deleted` event.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the datastore entry.

params.name: rev
params.description:
Specific revision to read. Defaults to
latest revision.

return.desc:
Promise resolved to a new `_rev` property of deleted
object.

methods.name: revertRemove
methods.description:
Reverts deleted items.
This function fires `request-object-changed` event for each restored
request.

params.name: items
params.description:
List of request objects. Required properties are
`_id` and `_rev`.

return.desc:
Resolved promise with restored objects. Objects have
updated `_rev` property.

methods.name: _findNotDeleted
methods.description: Finds last not deleted revision of a document.

return.desc: Last not deleted version of each document.

methods.name: _findUndeletedRevision
methods.description:
Finds a next revision after the `deletedRevision` in the revisions history
which is the one that reverts any changes made after it.

return.desc:
Revision ID of the object before a change registered in
`deletedRevision`

methods.name: _handleRead
methods.description: Handler for request read event request.

methods.name: _handleObjectSave
methods.description: Handles onject save / update

methods.name: _handleObjectDelete
methods.description: Deletes the object from the datastore.

methods.name: _handleObjectsDelete
methods.description: Queries for a list of projects.

methods.name: _handleUndelete
methods.description: handlers `request-objects-undeleted` event to restore deleted items

methods.name: _filterExistingItems
methods.description: Filters query results to return only successfuly read data.

return.desc: List of request that has been read.

methods.name: _findOldRef
methods.description: Finds a `_rev` for a doc.

params.name: docs
params.description: List of PouchDB documents to search for `_rev`

return.desc: Associated `_rev`

methods.name: _saveGoogleDrive
methods.description:
Saves the request on Google Drive.
It sends `drive-request-save` event to call a component responsible
for saving the request.

This do nothing if `opts.drive is not set.`

params.name: opts
params.description: Save request options. See `saveRequest` for more info.

return.desc: Resolved promise to updated object.

methods.name: _preparePayload
methods.description:
Prepares payload data to be stored in the datastore.
FormData are translated to a `multipart` entry property.
Payload is cleared from the request object.

return.desc: Promise resolved to a request object.

methods.name: _createMultipartEntry
methods.description:
Computes `multipart` list value to replace FormData with array that can
be stored in the datastore.

return.desc: Promise resolved to a form part representation.

methods.name: _computeFormDataEntry
methods.description:
Recuresively iterates over form data and appends result of creating the
part object to the `result` array.

Each part entry contains `name` as a form part name, value as a string
representation of the value and `isFile` to determine is the value is
acttually a string or a file data.

params.name: textParts
params.description:
From `_arcMeta` property. List of blobs
that should be treated as text parts.

params.name: result
params.description:
An array where the results are appended to.
It creates new result object when it's not passed.

return.desc: A promise resolved to the `result` array.

methods.name: _blobToString
methods.description: Converts blob data to base64 string.

params.name: blob
params.description: File or blob object to be translated to string

return.desc: Promise resolved to a base64 string data from the file.

methods.name: _indexRequest
methods.description:
Updates or creates request search index used when querying for request
data.

This operation is async and in a web worker (separate thred).

methods.name: _deleteIndex
methods.description: Removed URL index data when the request is deleted.

methods.name: _getIndexWorker
methods.description: Creates if nescesary and returns indexing web worker.

return.desc: An indexing web worker instance.

methods.name: _unregisterWorker
methods.description: Terminates the worker (if exists) and removes event listeners

methods.name: _onIndexWorkerData
methods.description: A handler for data returned from the request indexing worker.

methods.name: _onIndexWorkerError
methods.description: A handler for error returned from the request indexing worker.

methods.name: _handleQuery
methods.description:
A handler for the `request-query` custom event. Queries the datastore for
request data.
The event must have `q` property set on the detail object.

methods.name: queryUrlData
methods.description: Performs a query on the URL index data.

params.name: type
params.description:
Optional, type of the requests to search for.
By default it returns all data.

params.name: detailed
params.description:
If set it uses slower algorithm but performs full
search on the index. When false it only uses filer like query + '*'.

return.desc: Promise resolved to the list of requests.

methods.name: _urlQueryHandler
methods.description: Handler for URL index results search.

params.name: id
params.description:
The ID sent to the web worker to identify callback
function.

params.name: results
params.description: Map of request id - request type.

methods.name: query
methods.description:
Performs a query on the request data store.
It uses PouchDB `query` function on built indexes.
Note, it does not query URL data.

params.name: type
params.description:
Optional, type of the requests to search for.
By default it returns all data for both history and saved.

return.desc: Promise resolved to the list of requests.

methods.name: queryHistory
methods.description: Queries history store using PouchDB quick search plugin (full text search).

return.desc: Promise resolved to the list of requests.

methods.name: querySaved
methods.description: Queries Saved store using PouchDB quick search plugin (full text search).

return.desc: Promise resolved to the list of requests.

methods.name: indexData
methods.description: Performs data index using PouchDB api.

elements.name: LogicElements.RequestModel

attributes.name: no-indexing
attributes.description: When set it skips request indexing.

events.name: drive-request-save
events.description:
Fired when the request should be expored to Google Drive.
This element doesn't support this operation but this way it queries for
an element that can export data to Google Drive.

events.name: export-google-drive
events.description:
Dispatched when saving request object to the data store and configuration
option says to save request to Google Drive.
This component does not handles the logic responsible for Drive integration.

Note, The request save flow fails when this event is not handled.

events.name: request-indexing-error
events.description:
Dispatched when request object indexing finishes with error.
This event does not bubbles.

events.name: request-indexing-finished
events.description:
Dispatched when request object indexing finishes.
This event does not bubbles.

events.name: request-object-changed
events.description: Fired when the project entity has been saved / updated in the datastore.

elements.description:
Events based access to websockets URL history datastore.

Note: **All events must be cancelable.** When the event is cancelled by an instance
of the element it won't be handled again by other instance that possibly exists
in the DOM.

Cancellable event is a request to models for change. Non-cancellable event
is a notification for views to update their values.
For example `request-object-changed` event notifies model to update object in
the datastore if the event is cancelable and to update views if it's not
cancellable.

Each handled event contains the `result` property on the `detail` object. It
contains a `Promise` object with a result of the operation. Also, for update / delete
events the same non-cancelable event is fired.

Events handled by this element are cancelled and propagation of the event is
stopped.

Removes old handlers (if any) and attaches listeners on new event
event target.

Event target to set handlers on. If not set it
will set handlers on the `window` object.

params.name: id

params.name: rev
params.description: Specific revision to read. Defaults to latest revision.

return.desc: Promise resolved to a datastore object.

methods.name: _computeMidnight
methods.description: Computes past mindnight for given timestamp.

return.desc: Time reduced to midnight.

methods.name: _fireUpdated
methods.description: Dispatches non-cancelable change event.

return.desc: Created and dispatched event.

methods.name: _handleException
methods.description: Handles any exception in the model in a unified way.

params.name: noThrow
params.description:
If set the function will not throw error.
This allow to do the logic without stopping program.

methods.name: _handleRead
methods.description: Handles the read object event

methods.name: update
methods.description:
Updates / saves the object in the datastore.
This function fires `websocket-url-history-changed` event.

return.desc: Resolved promise to project object with updated `_rev`

methods.name: list
methods.description: Lists websocket history objects.

params.name: query
params.description: A partial url to match results.

return.desc: A promise resolved to a list of PouchDB documents.

methods.name: _computeTime
methods.description: Computes time for timestamp's day, month and year and time set to 0.

return.desc: The same database item with `_time` property.

elements.name: LogicElements.WebsocketUrlHistoryModel

properties.name: eventsTarget
properties.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on
`window` object. If set, all events listeners will be attached to this
object instead of `window`.

properties.name: _oldEventsTarget
properties.description: An event target used to attach listeners.

properties.name: indexDb
properties.description: A handler to the datastroe contains listing data

properties.name: dataDb
properties.description:
A handler to the datastore containing REST API data
(raml definition).

properties.name: _cachedQueryOptions
properties.description:
Cached query options for index data listing.
Keys is the nextPageToken returned with listing response. If the
page token has been used with the query it will takes this data
to return next page results.

properties.name: defaultQueryOptions
properties.description:
Database query options for pagination.
Override this value to change the query options like limit of the results in one call.

This is query options passed to the PouchDB `allDocs` function. Note that it will not
set `include_docs` option. A conviniet shortcut is to set the the `includeDocs` property
and the directive will be added automatically.

methods.name: _eventsTargetChanged
methods.description:
Removes old handlers (if any) and attaches listeners on new event
event target.

params.name: eventsTarget
params.description:
Event target to set handlers on. If not set it
will set handlers on the `window` object.

methods.name: read
methods.description: Reads an entry from the datastore.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the datastore entry.

params.name: rev
params.description: Specific revision to read. Defaults to latest revision.

return.desc: Promise resolved to a datastore object.

methods.name: _computeMidnight
methods.description: Computes past mindnight for given timestamp.

return.desc: Time reduced to midnight.

methods.name: _fireUpdated
methods.description: Dispatches non-cancelable change event.

return.desc: Created and dispatched event.

methods.name: _handleException
methods.description: Handles any exception in the model in a unified way.

params.name: noThrow
params.description:
If set the function will not throw error.
This allow to do the logic without stopping program.

methods.name: readIndex
methods.description: Reads an entry from the index datastore.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the datastore entry.

params.name: rev
params.description: Specific revision to read. Defaults to latest revision.

return.desc: Promise resolved to a project object.

methods.name: readData
methods.description: Reads an entry from the raml data datastore.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the datastore entry.

params.name: rev
params.description: Specific revision to read. Defaults to latest revision.

return.desc: Promise resolved to a project object.

methods.name: updateData
methods.description:
Creates / updates API data object.
The `_id` property must be already set on the object.

This function fires `rest-api-data-updated` custom event on success.

return.desc: Resolved promise to a document with updated `_rev`

methods.name: updateIndex
methods.description:
Creates / updates API index object.
The `_id` property must be already set on the object.

This function fires `rest-api-index-updated` custom event on success.

return.desc: Resolved promise to a document with updated `_rev`

methods.name: updateIndexBatch
methods.description: Updates many index objects in one request.

params.name: docs
params.description: List of PouchDB documents to update.

return.desc: Resolved promise to a list of document with updated `_rev`

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Removes data from index and raml data datastores.

params.name: id
params.description:
Datastore entry ID to delete. Both data and index objects
shares the same ID.

return.desc: Promise resolved to a new `_rev` property of deleted object.

methods.name: create
methods.description:
Creates datastores entries for REST API.
It creates data object and index object used for listings.

params.name: order
params.description: Optional, creates a datastore entry with given order.

return.desc:
A promise resolved when the datastore objects are created.
Resolved promise contains index object.

methods.name: listIndex
methods.description:
Lists index data.

### QueryResultObject
- `data` {Array<Object>} List of PouchDB documents read from the datastore
- `nextPageToken` {String} Pagination string to be used with next call
to get resutls for a next page. The nextPageToken don't change over
subsequent requests.

params.name: opts
params.description:
Query options:
- nextPageToken {String} Received from previous query page token.

return.desc: A promise resolved to a query result object on success.

methods.name: _makeNextPageToken
methods.description: Generates `nextPageToken` as a random string.

return.desc: Random 32 characters long string.

methods.name: _createHandler
methods.description:
A handler for `rest-api-create` custom event.
It only handles event's that hasn't been cancelled.

Required detail property is `raml` with the RAML data to insert.
Optional property is `order` that describes order on the list.

It sets a `result` property on the event `detail` object that is a
promise returned by `create()` function.

methods.name: _readHandler
methods.description:
Handler for the `rest-api-read` custom event.
It only handles event's that hasn't been cancelled.

Event `detail` object must contain the `id` property with datastore entry
id and may contain a `rev` property to read a specific revision.

It sets a `result` property on the event `detail` object that is a
promise returned by `readData()` function.

methods.name: _indexUpdatedHandler
methods.description:
A handler for the `rest-api-index-updated` custom event.
It is only handled if the event in cancelable and not cancelled.

Updates index object in the datastore and sets `result` property on the
event detail object with a result of calling `updateIndex()` function.

methods.name: _dataUpdatedHandler
methods.description:
A handler for the `rest-api-data-updated` custom event.
It is only handled if the event in cancelable and not cancelled.

Updates RAML data object in the datastore and sets `result` property on the
event detail object with a result of calling `updateData()` function.

methods.name: _deletedHandler
methods.description:
Deletes the object from the datastores.
It is only handled if the event in cancelable and not cancelled.

Event has to have `id` property set on the detail object.

It sets `result` property on the event detail object with a result of
calling `remove()` function.

methods.name: _indexesUpdatedHandler
methods.description:
Handler for the `rest-api-index-updated-batch` custom event.
It requires to have `docs` property set to event detail as an array of
PouchDB documents to update.

It sets `result` property on the event detail object with a result of
calling `updateIndexBatch()` function.

methods.name: _indexListHandler
methods.description:
Handler for the `rest-api-index-list` custom event.

The `detail` object can contain `nextPageToken` property used for pagination.

It sets `result` property on the event detail object with a result of
calling `listIndex()` function.

methods.name: _prepareStoreObject
methods.description: Prepares PouchDB data object to store in the datastore.

return.desc: Datastore object

methods.name: _prepareIndexObject
methods.description: Prepares index data store object for the REST API.

params.name: storeObject
params.description: A store object with RAML data

params.name: order
params.description: Optional, creates a datastore entry with given order.

return.desc: Index store object.

elements.name: LogicElements.RestApiModel

attributes.name: default-query-options
attributes.description:
Database query options for pagination.
Override this value to change the query options like limit of the results in one call.

This is query options passed to the PouchDB `allDocs` function. Note that it will not
set `include_docs` option. A conviniet shortcut is to set the the `includeDocs` property
and the directive will be added automatically.

events.name: rest-api-data-updated
events.description:
Fired when RAML (API) data has been updated.
The event is non cancelable which means that the change is commited to the
datastore.

It sets a `result` property on event `detail` object which contains a return
value from calling `updateData()` function.

events.name: rest-api-deleted
events.description:
Fired when data has been deleted.
The event is non cancelable which means that the change is commited to the
datastore.

It sets a `result` property on event `detail` object which contains a return
value from calling `remove()` function.

events.name: rest-api-index-updated
events.description:
Fired when index data has been updated.
The event is non cancelable which means that the change is commited to the
datastore.

It sets a `result` property on event `detail` object which contains a return
value from calling `updateIndex()` function.

properties.name: eventsTarget
properties.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on
`window` object. If set, all events listeners will be attached to this
object instead of `window`.

properties.name: _oldEventsTarget
properties.description: An event target used to attach listeners.

properties.name: db
properties.description: A handler to host rules database

methods.name: _eventsTargetChanged
methods.description:
Removes old handlers (if any) and attaches listeners on new event
event target.

params.name: eventsTarget
params.description:
Event target to set handlers on. If not set it
will set handlers on the `window` object.

methods.name: read
methods.description: Reads an entry from the datastore.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the datastore entry.

params.name: rev
params.description: Specific revision to read. Defaults to latest revision.

return.desc: Promise resolved to a datastore object.

methods.name: _computeMidnight
methods.description: Computes past mindnight for given timestamp.

return.desc: Time reduced to midnight.

methods.name: _fireUpdated
methods.description: Dispatches non-cancelable change event.

return.desc: Created and dispatched event.

methods.name: _handleException
methods.description: Handles any exception in the model in a unified way.

params.name: noThrow
params.description:
If set the function will not throw error.
This allow to do the logic without stopping program.

methods.name: update
methods.description:
Updates / saves the host rule object in the datastore.
This function fires `host-rules-changed` event.

params.name: rule
params.description: A rule object to save / update

return.desc: Resolved promise to updated object with updated `_rev`

methods.name: remove
methods.description:
Removed an object from the datastore.
This function fires `host-rules-deleted` event.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the datastore entry.

params.name: rev
params.description: Specific revision to read. Defaults to latest revision.

return.desc: Promise resolved to a new `_rev` property of deleted object.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Lists all existing host rules

return.desc: Promise resolved to list of the host rules
